questions.text: A 56-year-old male prescribed an infected insect bite above his right knee. A large, tender, fluctuant right inguinal lymph node was identified along with several adjacent lymph nodes that were mildly enlarged. Serology for tularemia was found to be reactive. questions.explanation:
Solution:

Streptomycin Streptomycin is an antibiotic used in the treatment of tuberculosis, in combination with other medicines. It works by stopping the growth of tubercular bacteria. Rarely, it may also be used to treat some other types of infections.

Indication of streptomycin: Pulmonary tuberculosis Plague dysentery SABE UTI RTI Peritonitis Meningitis

options.label: B
options.text: Treat her with an intravenous dose of amoxicillin

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: D. Treat her with a single oral dose of azithromycin
questions.explanation:

Treat her with a single oral dose of azithromycin

questions.text: A patient on antitubercular drug therapy developed a tingling sensation on the lower limb. Which of the following drug should be used for treatment?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pyridoxine

Highyeild:

The patient is developing a tingling sensation which is a side effect of isoniazid(INH) a first-line antitubercular drug. INH is extensively metabolised in the liver, the most important pathway being the N-acetylation of NAT2. The acetylated metabolite is excreted in the urine. The rate of INH acetylation shows genetic variation. They are either: Fast acetylators: (30-40% of Indians) t1/2 of INH 1 hr. Slow acetylators: ( 60-70% of Indians) t1/2 of INH 3hr Slow acetylators will not be able to metabolize the drug quickly and there will be accumulation of isoniazid. Isoniazid inhibits pyridoxal phosphokinase enzyme and hence causes peripheral neuritis, paraesthesia, numbness etc. Pyridoxine given prophylactically prevents this neurotoxicity. On the other hand, fast acetylators are more prone to develop
